name: DocumentDB High memory consumption for {{dbinstanceidentifier.name}} in {{region.name}} - DD Example
message:
Note: When performing a high rate of concurrent batchInsert and/or batchUpdate operations, and the amount of aws.docdb.freeable_memory (FreeableMemory in CloudWatch Metric) goes to zero on your primary instance, you can either reduce the concurrency of the batch insert or update workload or, if concurrency of the workload cannot be reduced, increase the instance size to increase the amount of aws.docdb.freeable_memory/FreeableMemory.

See in [Datadog](https://app.datadoghq.com/screen/integration/266/aws-documentdb)
See in [AWS Console](https://console.aws.amazon.com/docdb/home?region={{region.name}}#clusters)  


[DocumentDB Monitoring best practices](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/documentdb/latest/developerguide/best_practices.html)
Available memory would vary based on instance type. See [here for details](https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/instance-types/)
